description: This course immediately precedes (Social Work 380): Field Practicum. Students integrate
principles and skills of culturally competent assessment, planning, intervention, and evaluation
with diverse clients -- individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities. They roleplay
diverse practice situations and articulate implications of social policy for cross-cultural practice
Brief immersion opportunities in diverse communities are included. Additional fee. Prerequisite:
Social Work 261. For senior majors only. Offered annually in September.
